docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on wills that create an impossible choice, lying on a job application and bailing out a destitute friend.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on wills that create an impossible choice, lying on a job application and bailing out a destitute friend.
docs.lead_paragraph: My husband and I have been together for many years and have a teenage daughter; he also has a daughter from a prior relationship, who is a grown woman. He is a wonderful father to both. He has covered all my stepdaughter’s expenses from childhood, and her education, including living expenses and vacations. We are not rich but have a good income. He is the main breadwinner. I have no assets or savings myself.

headline.main: My Husband’s Will Pits Me Against Our Daughter. What Can I Do?
headline.print_headline: My Husband’s Will Pits Me Against Our Daughter. What Can I Do?

docs.abstract: At least seven pro-government forces and seven civilians were killed in Afghanistan during the past week.
docs.snippet: At least seven pro-government forces and seven civilians were killed in Afghanistan during the past week.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least seven pro-government forces and seven civilians were killed in Afghanistan during the past week. Casualties among pro-government forces and civilians decreased significantly compared to previous weeks. The only mass-casualty incident against Afghan forces occurred in Badakhshan Province, where four pro-government forces were killed. Two pro-government forces were also killed a military operation against the Taliban in Herat Province, where officials claimed that 12 insurgents were killed. There were several Taliban attacks on outposts and bases, but Afghan security forces did not suffer casualties, which may be attributed to the improved arrival time of reinforcements. Airstrikes and commando operations were also accelerated all over the country recently.

docs.abstract: Break down the characters into chunks and repeat them over and over. Write them down ASAP, even if only in the dirt.
docs.snippet: Break down the characters into chunks and repeat them over and over. Write them down ASAP, even if only in the dirt.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Memory decays very quickly,” says Caren Rotello, chairwoman of the Department of Psychological and Brain Sciences at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. In studies about license-plate recall, people who see a plate for three or fewer seconds remember an average of around 3.5 characters (and fewer when seen reversed in a rearview mirror). After that, the more time that elapses, the more you’ll forget. “Write it down immediately,” Rotello says. “Even if you just take a stick or your finger and write in the dirt.”

headline.main: How to Remember a License Plate
headline.print_headline: How to Remember a License Plate

docs.abstract: Love letter to an iconic pair of old-school kicks.
docs.snippet: Love letter to an iconic pair of old-school kicks.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Wake up, dummy!” my cousin yelled through my bedroom door. This was back in 1998, about 7 a.m. “You got the Foot Locker interview! We need that discount! Get up!”
